string_data:
ID: BBC_2023-10-13_Just-Stop-Oil-spraypaint
Source: BBC
Title: #DS Just Stop Oil spray-paint English universities orange #DE
Content: #DS #PH #CS A protester at King's College Cambridge sprayed paint on a building using a fire extinguisher. (Alt: The image shows a Gothic stone building with ornate windows and architectural details covered in bright orange spray paint. A person sits on the grass in front of the vandalized building. The orange paint creates stark streaks across the historic stone facade.) #CE

Climate campaigners Just Stop Oil have sprayed universities across England with orange paint in protests against the UK Government's plans to license new oil and gas projects.Protests were reported on Thursday at the universities of Leeds, Manchester and Cambridge, following demonstrations at Bristol on Monday, Exeter and Oxford on Tuesday, and Falmouth, Sussex, Birmingham and UCL on Wednesday. #DE #MS The protests follow last month's approval of the Rosebank oil field, the UK's largest untapped oil field estimated to contain up to 300 million barrels of oil. #ME #DS At the University of Leeds, recent graduate Sam Holland was filmed "redecorating orange" the Great Hall, spraying orange paint on the building and #MS shouting the university is "complicit in genocide" through its graduate schemes. #ME He was dragged away by police and a 21-year-old man was arrested on suspicion of criminal damage. #DE

#NS A University of Leeds spokesperson said while they "support the right to legal protest", they were "hugely disappointed" the demonstration had led to vandalism. #NE The university said it was "taking a robust approach to tackling the existential challenge of climate change, with a Â£174m Climate Plan which includes our target of delivering net zero emissions by 2030" and avoids companies "materially engaged in certain sectors, including thermal coal, the extraction of fossil fuel from tar sands, oil and gas extraction, production and refining."

#DS #MS #PH #CS Just Stop Oil said protests like the one at Exeter University were against government plans for new oil and gas projects (Alt: A large crowd of people, mostly young adults who appear to be students, gather outside a modern glass building. Orange ) #CE #ME

At the University of Cambridge, protester Chiara Sarti used a fire extinguisher to "paint the neo-Gothic King's College orange". #NS Members of the public confronted the activist #NE in front of the college, which was founded by King Henry VI in 1441. A 24-year-old was arrested for criminal damage. #DE

#NS A spokesperson for King's College said: "The college is concerned about climate change and respects the right to freedom of speech and non-violent protest, but draws the line at criminal damage." #NE

#DS #PH #CS Falmouth University's building was covered in orange paint on Wednesday (Alt: The image shows Falmouth University's modern glass-fronted building with large orange paint stains covering the windows and entrance area. Several people, including students in colorful clothing, are gathered near the entrance steps. Red and white barrier tape is visible, cordoning off the affected area.) #CE #DE
